body: # GR.cr [![Join the chat at https://gitter.im/crystal-data/bottle](https://badges.gitter.im/crystal-data/bottle.svg)](https://gitter.im/crystal-data/bottle?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=badge) [![.github/workflows/ci.yml](https://github.com/crystal-data/GR.cr/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/crystal-data/GR.cr/actions/workflows/ci.yml) [Crystal](https://github.com/crystal-lang/crystal) bindings to [GR framework](https://github.com/sciapp/gr). GR.cr has been forked from [gr-crystal](https://github.com/jmakino/gr-crystal) by [Jun Makino](https://github.com/jmakino). ## Installation ### GR Installation #### [Official release](https://github.com/sciapp/gr/releases) - Linux, Mac, Windows Set `GRDIR` : `export GRDIR="your/path/to/gr"` #### [OpenSUSE build service](https://software.opensuse.org//download.html?project=science%3Agr-framework&package=gr) - Linux Set `GRDIR` : `export GRDIR="/usr/gr"` #### [Homebrew](https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/libgr) - Mac `brew install libgr` ### GR.cr installation Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`: ```yaml dependencies: gr: github: crystal-data/GR.cr ``` Run `shards install` ## API Overview - `libGR`, `libGR3`, `libGRM` : call native functions directly. - `GR`, `GR3`, `GRM` : call module function customized for Crystal. ``` ┌──────────────┐ ┌──────────────┐ ┌──────────────┐ │ GRM │ │ GR │ │ GR3 │ │ ┌──────────┐ │ │ ┌──────────┐ │ │ ┌──────────┐ │ │ │ LibGRM │ │ │ │ LibGR │ │ │ │ LibGR3 │ │ │ └──────────┘ │ │ └──────────┘ │ │ └──────────┘ │ └──────────────┘ └──────────────┘ └──────────────┘ ``` GR.cr is still immature, but even in its current state, GRM can be used to create good quality figures. ## Quick Start With the GRM module, you can easily display beautiful charts. ```crystal require "../src/grm" n = 1000 x = [] of Float64 y = [] of Float64 z = [] of Float64 n.times do |i| x << i * 30.0 / n y << Math.cos(x[i]) * x[i] z << Math.sin(x[i]) * x[i] end plot_types = %w[line hexbin polar shade stem step contour trisurf plot3 scatter scatter3] plot_types.each do |type| GRM.clear args = GRM.args_new GRM.args_push(args, "x", "nD", n, x) GRM.args_push(args, "y", "nD", n, y) GRM.args_push(args, "z", "nD", n, z) GRM.args_push(args, "kind", "s", type) GRM.args_push(args, "title", "s", type) GRM.plot(args) sleep 2 end ``` ## Usage Please see the example directory. With GR and GR3 modules, you can do more serious visualization. However, you may find that GR.cr is not fully implemented. In that case, please send me a pull request. ## Development Low-level bindings are automatically generated by [crystal_lib](https://github.com/crystal-lang/crystal_lib). GR.cr is a library under development, so even small improvements like fixing typos are welcome! Please feel free to send us your PR. The author is not familiar with Crystal, so it may be written in an inefficient way, and you may be able to fix it. - Look at [GR.rb](https://github.com/red-data-tools/GR.rb) and implement the missing methods! - Report bugs - Fix bugs and submit pull requests - Write, clarify, or fix documentation - Suggest or add new features ## Acknowledgements We would like to thank Josef Heinen, the creator of [GR](https://github.com/sciapp/gr) and [GR.jl](https://github.com/jheinen/GR.jl), Florian Rhiem, the creator of [python-gr](https://github.com/sciapp/python-gr), and all [GR](https://github.com/sciapp/gr) developers.

def.name: axes3d
def.body: LibGR.axes3d(x, x1, x2, x3, x4, x5, i, i1, i2, x6)

instance_methods.name: box
instance_methods.args_string: (x_tick = (GRparms.winmax[0] - GRparms.winmin[0]) * 0.25, y_tick = (GRparms.winmax[1] - GRparms.winmin[1]) * 0.25, x_org = GRparms.winmin[0], y_org = GRparms.winmin[1], major_x = 1, major_y = 1, tick_size = 0.01, xlog = false, ylog = false)
instance_methods.args_html: (x_tick = (GRparms.winmax[0] - GRparms.winmin[0]) * 0.25, y_tick = (GRparms.winmax[1] - GRparms.winmin[1]) * 0.25, x_org = GRparms.winmin[0], y_org = GRparms.winmin[1], major_x = 1, major_y = 1, tick_size = 0.01, xlog = false, ylog = false)

def.name: box
def.body:
scalearg = 0
if xlog
  scalearg = scalearg + 1
end
if ylog
  scalearg = scalearg + 2
end
LibGR.setscale(scalearg)
LibGR.setcharheight(GRparms.charheight.to_f)
LibGR.axes(x_tick, y_tick, x_org, y_org, major_x, major_y, tick_size)
LibGR.setcharheight(0.00001)
LibGR.axes(x_tick, y_tick, GRparms.winmax[0], GRparms.winmax[1], major_x, major_y, -tick_size)
LibGR.setcharheight(GRparms.charheight.to_f)

def.name: to_cchar
def.body:
cp = Pointer(UInt8).malloc(s.size + 1)
i = 0
s.each_byte do |c| cp[i] = c
i = i + 1
 end

cp[s.size] = 0
cp

instance_methods.name: bar
instance_methods.doc: Create a bar plot (using Plot class internally)
instance_methods.summary: Create a bar plot (using Plot class internally)
instance_methods.args_string: (x : Array(Number), y : Array(Number), title : String | Nil = nil, xlabel : String | Nil = nil, ylabel : String | Nil = nil, color : String | Nil = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (x : Array(Number), y : Array(Number), title : String | Nil = nil, xlabel : String | Nil = nil, ylabel : String | Nil = nil, color : String | Nil = nil)

def.name: bar
def.body:
plot = (Plot.new
  .data(x, y))
  .bar
if title
  plot.title(title)
end
if xlabel
  plot.xlabel(xlabel)
end
if ylabel
  plot.ylabel(ylabel)
end
if color
  plot.color(color)
end
plot.show

  .data2d(x, y, z))
  .contour(z.size, z.first.size)

end
if xlabel

end
if ylabel
  plot.ylabel(ylabel)
end
plot.show

instance_methods.name: plot
instance_methods.doc: Unified plot function (like the original low-level API)
instance_methods.summary: Unified plot function (like the original low-level API)
instance_methods.args_string: (x : Array(Number), y : Array(Number), z : Array(Number) | Nil = nil, kind : String = "line", title : String | Nil = nil, xlabel : String | Nil = nil, ylabel : String | Nil = nil, zlabel : String | Nil = nil, color : String | Nil = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (x : Array(Number), y : Array(Number), z : Array(Number) | Nil = nil, kind : String = "line", title : String | Nil = nil, xlabel : String | Nil = nil, ylabel : String | Nil = nil, zlabel : String | Nil = nil, color : String | Nil = nil)

def.name: plot
def.body:
args = args_new
x_data = x.map(&.to_f64)
y_data = y.map(&.to_f64)

args_push(args, "x", "nD", x_data.size, x_data)
args_push(args, "y", "nD", y_data.size, y_data)

if z
  z_data = z.map(&.to_f64)
  args_push(args, "z", "nD", z_data.size, z_data)
end

args_push(args, "kind", "s", kind)
if title
  args_push(args, "title", "s", title)
end
if xlabel
  args_push(args, "xlabel", "s", xlabel)
end
if ylabel
  args_push(args, "ylabel", "s", ylabel)
end
if zlabel
  args_push(args, "zlabel", "s", zlabel)
end
if color
  args_push(args, "color", "s", color)
end

plot(args)

def.name: add_plot
clear
save
def.body:
if @plots.empty?
  return self
end


if (!@created) || @dirty
  show
end


LibGRM.switch(@plot_id)
LibGRM.export(path)
self

def.name: show
def.body:
if @plots.empty?
  return self
end
if @created && (!@dirty)
  return self
end


if @created
  LibGRM.switch(@plot_id)
  LibGRM.clear
end

last_index = @plots.size - 1



@plots.each_with_index do |plot, i|

  temp_args = plot.build_series_args


  LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "plot_id", "i", @plot_id)


  if i == last_index
    if @title
      LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "title", "s", @title.as(String))
    end
    if @xlabel
      LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "xlabel", "s", @xlabel.as(String))
    end
    if @ylabel
      LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "ylabel", "s", @ylabel.as(String))
    end
  end


  LibGRM.merge(temp_args)

  LibGRM.args_delete(temp_args)
end

@created = true
@dirty = false
self

instance_methods.summary: Figure-level label setting methods

instance_methods.name: to_html
instance_methods.doc: Convenience methods
instance_methods.summary: Convenience methods

def.name: to_html
def.body:
if @plots.empty?
  return ""
end


if (!@created) || @dirty
  show
end


LibGRM.switch(@plot_id)
html_ptr = id ? LibGRM.dump_html(id) : LibGRM.dump_html(nil)
String.new(html_ptr)

def.name: to_json
def.body:
if @plots.empty?
  return "{}"
end


if (!@created) || @dirty
  show
end


LibGRM.switch(@plot_id)
json_ptr = LibGRM.dump_json_str
String.new(json_ptr)

types.name: Plot
types.doc: Crystal-style Plot class for method chaining

instance_methods.name: apply_settings
instance_methods.doc: Method to apply all settings for standalone Plot usage
instance_methods.summary: Method to apply all settings for standalone Plot usage

instance_methods.name: build_series_args
instance_methods.doc: Method to build clean args without polluting internal state
instance_methods.summary: Method to build clean args without polluting internal state

def.name: build_series_args
def.body:
temp_args = LibGRM.args_new


if @x_data
  LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "x", "nD", @x_data.not_nil!.size, @x_data.not_nil!)
end
if @y_data && !@y_data.not_nil!.empty?
  LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "y", "nD", @y_data.not_nil!.size, @y_data.not_nil!)
end
if @z_data
  LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "z", "nD", @z_data.not_nil!.size, @z_data.not_nil!)


  if (@kind == "surface") || (@kind == "contour")
    if @m && @n
    else
      raise(ArgumentError.new("2D kinds (#{@kind}) require m and n to be set"))
    end
    LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "m", "i", @m.as(Int32))
    LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "n", "i", @n.as(Int32))
  end
end


if ((@kind == "surface") || (@kind == "contour")) && (!@z_data)
  raise(ArgumentError.new("2D kinds (#{@kind}) require z data to be set"))
end



kind_to_use = @kind || "line"
LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "kind", "s", kind_to_use)
if @color
  LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "color", "s", @color.as(String))
end
if @nbins
  LibGRM.args_push(temp_args, "nbins", "i", @nbins.as(Int32))
end

temp_args

instance_methods.args_string: (m : Int32 | Nil = nil, n : Int32 | Nil = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (m : Int32 | Nil = nil, n : Int32 | Nil = nil)

def.name: contour

instance_methods.name: data
instance_methods.doc: Data setting methods (chainable) - for 1D series
instance_methods.summary: Data setting methods (chainable) - for 1D series
instance_methods.args_string: (x : Array(Number), y : Array(Number), z : Array(Number) | Nil = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (x : Array(Number), y : Array(Number), z : Array(Number) | Nil = nil)

def.name: data
def.body:
if y.empty?
elsif x.size != y.size
  raise(ArgumentError.new("x and y arrays must have the same size"))
end

if z && (x.size != z.size)
  raise(ArgumentError.new("x, y, and z arrays must have the same size"))
end

@x_data = x.map(&.to_f64)
@y_data = y.map(&.to_f64)
@z_data = z ? z.map(&.to_f64) : nil


LibGRM.args_push(@args, "x", "nD", @x_data.not_nil!.size, @x_data.not_nil!)
if y.empty?
else
  LibGRM.args_push(@args, "y", "nD", @y_data.not_nil!.size, @y_data.not_nil!)
end

if @z_data
  LibGRM.args_push(@args, "z", "nD", @z_data.not_nil!.size, @z_data.not_nil!)
end

self

instance_methods.name: data
instance_methods.doc: Convenience method for point arrays
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method for point arrays

def.name: data
def.body:
x = points.map(&.[](0))
y = points.map(&.[](1))
data(x, y)

instance_methods.name: data2d
instance_methods.doc: 2D data helper for surface/contour (z: m x n matrix)
instance_methods.summary: 2D data helper for surface/contour (z: m x n matrix)

def.name: data2d
def.body:
if z.empty?
  raise(ArgumentError.new("z must be non-empty"))
end
m = z.size
n = z.first.size
if z.all? do |row| row.size == n end
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("all rows of z must have the same length"))
end

@x_data = x.map(&.to_f64)
@y_data = y.map(&.to_f64)
@z_data = z.flatten.map(&.to_f64)
@m = m
@n = n


if @x_data.not_nil!.size == m
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("x length must equal m (#{@x_data.not_nil!.size} != #{m})"))
end
if @y_data.not_nil!.size == n
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("y length must equal n (#{@y_data.not_nil!.size} != #{n})"))
end


LibGRM.args_push(@args, "x", "nD", @x_data.not_nil!.size, @x_data.not_nil!)
LibGRM.args_push(@args, "y", "nD", @y_data.not_nil!.size, @y_data.not_nil!)
LibGRM.args_push(@args, "z", "nD", @z_data.not_nil!.size, @z_data.not_nil!)
LibGRM.args_push(@args, "m", "i", m)
LibGRM.args_push(@args, "n", "i", n)

self

instance_methods.summary: Plot type methods (chainable)

def.name: save
def.body:
temp_args = build_series_args
apply_standalone_labels(temp_args)

LibGRM.plot(temp_args)
LibGRM.export(path)

LibGRM.args_delete(temp_args)
self

instance_methods.name: show
instance_methods.doc:
Rendering and output methods
WARNING: This method calls LibGRM.clear which affects the global GRM state.
Do not use this method when working with Figure instances, as it may clear
other plots. This method is intended for standalone Plot usage only.
instance_methods.summary: Rendering and output methods WARNING: This method calls LibGRM.clear which affects the global GRM state.

def.name: show
def.body:
temp_args = build_series_args

apply_standalone_labels(temp_args)

LibGRM.clear
LibGRM.plot(temp_args)

LibGRM.args_delete(temp_args)
self

def.name: to_html
def.body:
show

  LibGRM.dump_html(plot_id)
else
